DOC.brief_summary: Trial compares two preoperative stage II and III rectal cancer treatment strategies: short term radiotherapy 5x5 Gy and delayed surgery after 6 weeks versus conventional chemoradiotherapy 50 Gy + 5Fu/Lv and surgery also after 6 weeks.
DOC.brief_title: Preoperative Chemoradiation Versus Short Term Radiation Alone With Delayed Surgery for Stage II and III Resectable Rectal Cancer
DOC.criteria: histologically confirmed stage II and III rectal cancer less than 15 cm from anal verge less than 80 years old no other cancer during 5 years period compensate cardiovascular, pulmonary, hepatic and renal functions. stage I or IV rectal cancer other cancer in 5 years period radiotherapy or chemotherapy in anamnesis not compensate cardiovascular, pulmonary, hepatic or renal functions, neurological, psychiatric disease, sepsis, etc. pregnancy or baby feeding
